ygData.subject: RE: PvP strategies for cler
ygData.msgSnippet: As with all things on this list it is helpful if we explain the level of our Cleric. I am only level 12. The first spell wiz s get like this is at level 16
ygData.messageBody:
As with all things on this list it is helpful if we explain the level of our
Cleric. I am only level 12. The first spell wiz's get like this is at level
16 Shieldskin. It stops about 100 hit points of melee damage then
disappears. However Magical attacks are not effected at all. It requires a
regent. Like our own level 14 spell that increases our hit points. I have
heard ,but have not had it verified ,that a magical attack nullifies it. It
is a long cast and therefore needs to be done before combat. It certainly
does not make them invulnerable!

-----Original Message-----
From: Ralph Carothers [mailto:CarothersR@...]
Sent: Friday, September 03, 1999 11:10 AM
To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] PvP strategies for cler



I forget the name of the shield...mobs have it to. You hit them and it
absorbs everything like our divine aura/barrier. That's more than enough
for them to cast and ream us.

-----Original Message-----
From: Chas Watkins [ mailto:cwatkins@... <mailto:cwatkins@...>
]
Sent: Friday, September 03, 1999 2:08 PM
To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] PvP strategies for cler


From: Chas Watkins <cwatkins@...>

Not sure what magical shields you are talking about. Wizards only get AC
adding and small damage ones. Which hardly makes them immune. As for melee
sure we suck against fighters ..rangers, warriors etc. but against pure
casters we rock!

-----Original Message-----
From: Ralph Carothers [ mailto:CarothersR@...
<mailto:CarothersR@...> ]
Sent: Friday, September 03, 1999 10:53 AM
To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] PvP strategies for cler



and btw- whacking them with weapons wont do squat if they have their magical

shields up, ESPECIALLY if your a cleric....we suck with melee

-----Original Message-----
From: Mr. J Daniels [ mailto:warpig@... <mailto:warpig@...> <
mailto:warpig@... <mailto:warpig@...> > ]
Sent: Friday, September 03, 1999 1:47 PM
To: 'EQ-Clerics@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [EQ-Clerics] PvP strategies for cler


From: "Mr. J Daniels" <warpig@...>

Maybe I need to clarify this, if you stun them and run behind them, you
can keep whacking them from behind with your weapon. TRUST ME,
STUN/Wrath etc, works GREAT. Blind also works, but a blinded foe CAN
STILL CAST on you, a stunned one CANT.


On Fri, 3 Sep 1999, Kevin Dailey wrote:

> From: Kevin Dailey <kevin_dailey@...>
>
> Mr. J Daniels said:
>
> "What i typically do is stun the chaster, then run behind them quickly
> at
> an angle, then start nuking them. When they unstun they take some time
> to turn around to look for you, when you notice this, stun them again."
>
>
> I reply:
>
> I'm don't know if this is good advice. For one thing, the lower level
> stun lasts only two seconds. By the time you've run around the caster,
> he's not stunned anymore. For another thing, the recast time for stun is
> very long. And, if the caster is smart, he won't turn around to find
> you. He should already have you targeted, and he'll just hit his cast
> button. He doesn't have to see you to cast a spell. And, if you're
> dueling, he should realize that you won't be outside his casting range.
> I think Flash of Light would yield better results. It lasts much longer
> (12-18 seconds, I think), and he cannot cast while blinded. If you want
> to confuse your opponent even more, cast Fear on him after you've
> blinded him. He'll never know what hit him.
>
> This from having dueled nasty necros in Lake Rathe. They really hated it
> when I Feared them, heh heh.
>
> Saidinn Witchwood
>
